You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
COMMUNICATIONS CLOUD
Use Enterprise Sales Management

After you set up Enterprise Sales Management, your sales team can use it to manage complex, large-transaction quotes and enterprise orders, apply discounts, create proposals, negotiate contracts, and place orders.

Enterprise Sales Management supports bulk upload and grouping of locations and subscribers, offer configuration, price overrides for each group, and the ability to apply discounts across the entire enterprise quote or enterprise order. These features enable your sales teams to manage thousands of line items throughout the sales cycle.

The user interface is built with customizable Lightning Web Components, an SDK, and other Core Components in Enterprise Sales Management. This topic provides a high-level view of its features and navigation.

Create an Enterprise Quote
To launch Enterprise Sales Management and create an enterprise quote for an account, you start by going to an account.
Reopen an Enterprise Quote
After you've created an enterprise quote, you might need to configure the quote later. For example, you created a quote but didn't upload the location or subscriber details. Or you need to update location or subscriber details. Or you need to update the selected products or specified product configuration. In such cases, how do you find and open an existing quote?
Create an Enterprise Order from a Quote
You can create an enterprise order from a quote to enrich it with additional information, including technical details such as installation date, router specifications, type of wiring required, and so on.
Create an Enterprise Order Directly
Skip creating a quote and create an enterprise order that has all the necessary technical information directly.
Reopen an Enterprise Order
After you've created an enterprise order, you sometimes need to configure the order later. For example, you created an enterprise order—but didn't upload the location or subscriber details, or you need to update location or subscriber details. You sometimes also need to update the selected products or specified product configuration. In such cases, you can reopen the enterprise order.
Manage Locations and Subscribers
Before you start adding products to your enterprise quote or enterprise order, you'll probably want to add locations or subscribers to assign the selected products to. Individual locations or subscribers are referred to as quote members or enterprise order members. If you group locations or subscribers together, those groups are referred to as quote groups or enterprise order groups.
Work with Groups in Enterprise Sales Management
A group is a named set of locations and subscribers that you can use to manage large numbers of quote line items or order line items in an enterprise quote or enterprise order. Using groups is useful when you have a large number of locations or subscribers for whom you want to place identical offers.
Delete Members in Bulk in Enterprise Sales Management
Delete subscribers or locations in bulk, instead of one by one.
Product Selection and Configuration in Enterprise Sales Management
As you create an enterprise quote or enterprise order, you can add products to the quote or order and then configure, price, and validate the quote or order using Enterprise Sales Management capabilities.
Linear Relationships Between Products in Enterprise Sales Management
With linear relationships, each product can have an independent lifecycle. They offer a simpler and more flexible ordering experience and support the creation of multiple and parallel change orders. With hierarchical relationships, the entire hierarchy has to be selected and configured during Move, Add, Change, Delete (MACD), and it's impossible to create parallel change orders.
Enterprise Quote or Enterprise Order Enrichment in Enterprise Sales Management
At any point while working on your enterprise quote or enterprise order, you can update the quote or order with details that weren’t available or not required earlier. For example, you can assign phone numbers, update a billing account, or enter an installation date for multiple line items. Quote or order enrichment allows you to make these changes either inline one at a time, or for multiple lines simultaneously.
Clone Quotes in Enterprise Sales Management
Create a quote with the same quote line items as an existing enterprise quote. Clone additional options based on the b2bQuoteCloneConfig session variable configuration.
Create a Proposal in Enterprise Sales Management
As you work on your enterprise quote, you might want to create a proposal to send to the customer for approval before you create an order. You can use the Vlocity Document Template to create an manage your proposal templates. After you have updated the templates as per your requirements, you can use these templates when you generate proposals from Enterprise Sales Management.
Create Final Orders in Enterprise Sales Management
When you've finalized your enterprise quote or enterprise order and don't expect further modifications, you can create final orders from Enterprise Sales Management. A primary order and all the associated sub-orders are created.
Enrich Order Product with Additional Information
In Enterprise Sales Management, any fields on the Quote Member object can be associated with corresponding fields on the Order Products object. When you provide specific values for these fields in an enterprise quote, those values are carried forward to the Order Product object. You can also update the Sub Orders page layout to display each field as a column on the Order Products page.
Submit Orders in Enterprise Sales Management
After you click Create Final Orders in Enterprise Sales Management, a primary order and all the required sub-orders are created corresponding to the enterprise quote or enterprise order. Depending on the size of the enterprise quote or enterprise order, this can take some time.
View Assets in Enterprise Sales Management
After you submit an order for an enterprise quote, you can view the assets in the Asset tab on the Account page. The asset viewer displays various details including the service account and the billing account associated with each asset, the one-time and recurring totals, and the status of each asset.
Set Pricing for Locations
In Spring '22 and later releases, Enterprise Sales Management allows you to configure the pricing based on the location of a site. This feature allows you accurately price locations based on country, state, or any other location-specific field.
Create and Enable Context Rules for Products on Quote Members in Enterprise Sales Management
In Spring ‘22 and later releases, Enterprise Sales Management allows you to create and enable context rules for products on quote members. Context rules in Enterprise Sales Management contain one or more conditions that determine the products that are available to a customer.
Add Assets to Quote
Select assets in the asset viewer of a business account page and add them to new or existing quotes of the business account to make necessary changes. Edit, delete, and disconnect these assets as needed.
Change the Plan of One or Multiple Assets
Upgrade or downgrade the plan of one or multiple assets (with the same plan) that are added to a quote. If you change the plan of a single asset, you can also compare the plan with the current plan.
Merge the Plans (Products) of Assets Added to a Quote
Merge the plans (products) of up to four assets added to a quote. The bundled plan includes the common and unique offers of the individual plans.
Enterprise Self-Service Portal
Enterprise Sales Management integrates with Salesforce Experience Cloud for self-service post-sales add, change, and delete processes. With the Enterprise Self-Service (ESS) portal, Enterprise Sales Management supports business-to-business transactions and business-to-customer transactions.
